revised_title: Cure for Hand Disorder Caused by Cleansing Brass Wire
tldr: A young man named Francis Newman lost the use of his hands due to cleaning brass wire. After trying various treatments, he was given a mixture of oil and an alkaline lixivium to apply as a liniment. This treatment gradually softened the skin on his hands, allowing him to regain use of his fingers. The author shares this successful treatment method for others who may experience similar hand disorders in the dyeing business.
